I recalled reading a short comedy by a fan featuring Tokio and her 
brother=
 Goro (later known as Morinusuke).  

For many years in both Japan's Shinse=
ngumi fandom and here in the 
west Takagi Goro (Morinusuke) is noted as a m=
essenger for Aizu troops 
during the siege in 1868 and he is even portrayed=
 as one in the old 
television miniseries BYAKKOTAI.  We know samurai woman=
 Yamamoto 
Yae taught many of the young men how to use guns and it was Yae =
who 
told us Tokio cut her hair.  Other than those details from the Boshin =
War 
we know Morinusuke was close to Fujita Goro who taught kenjutsu to 
th=
e former's sons.

If you are interested in a new details (to us) about Mori=
nusuke you can 
read this post:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/edojidai/mess=
age/606
which uses textual sources and translations by M

At this site: htt=
p://www5e.biglobe.ne.jp/~BCM27946/niijimayae.html
it tells of Yamamoto Yae =
and Takagi Goro providing enough suppressing 
fire against the invading Imp=
erial army to prevent their advance.

You have to keep in mind that Takagi =
was fifteen years old.
